nodes.documentation:
@title Hashed Timelock Contracts (HTLCs) on Ethereum ERC20 tokens.

* This contract provides a way to create and keep HTLCs for $ONCE token.

*
Protocol:

*  1) newContract(hashlock, timelock, tokenContract, amount) - a
    sender calls this to create a new HTLC on a given token (tokenContract)
    for a given amount. A 32 byte contract id is returned
 3) refund() - after timelock has expired creator of the HTLC can get their tokens
    back with this function.
nodes.name: HashedTimelockERC20

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "timelock time must be in the future"

arguments.value: timelock time must be in the future

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "timelock time must be in the future"

nodes.name: newContract
refund
extendTimeLock
getContract

nodes.documentation:
@dev Is there a contract with id _contractId.
@param _contractId Id into contracts mapping.
nodes.name: haveContract

nodes.documentation:
@title Hashed Timelock Contracts (HTLCs) on Ethereum ERC20 tokens.

* This contract provides a way to create and keep HTLCs for $ONCE token.

*
Protocol:

*  1) newContract(hashlock, timelock, tokenContract, amount) - a
    sender calls this to create a new HTLC on a given token (tokenContract)
    for a given amount. A 32 byte contract id is returned
 3) refund() - after timelock has expired creator of the HTLC can get their tokens
    back with this function.
nodes.name: HashedTimelockERC20

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "timelock time must be in the future"

arguments.value: timelock time must be in the future

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "timelock time must be in the future"

nodes.name: newContract
refund
extendTimeLock
getContract

nodes.documentation:
@dev Is there a contract with id _contractId.
@param _contractId Id into contracts mapping.
nodes.name: haveContract

extendTimeLock(bytes32,bytes32,uint256).details: Called by the sender when the time lock has expired. This will restore ownership of the tokens to the sender.

params._contractId: Id of HTLC to refund from.
params._timelock: UNIX epoch seconds new time the lock expires at.

getContract(bytes32).return: All parameters in struct LockContract for _contractId HTLC

newContract(bytes32,uint256,address,uint.details: Sender sets up a new hash time lock contract depositing the funds and providing the hashlock.      * NOTE: Sender must first call approve() on the token contract.      See allowance check in tokensTransferable modifier.

params._amount: Amount of the token to lock up.
params._timelock: UNIX epoch seconds time that the lock expires at.                 Refunds can be made after this time.

newContract(bytes32,uint256,address,uint.return: contractId Id of the new HTLC. This is needed for subsequent calls.

refund(bytes32,bytes32).details: Called by the sender when the time lock has expired. This will restore ownership of the tokens to the sender.

params._contractId: Id of HTLC to refund from.

devdoc.title: Hashed Timelock Contracts (HTLCs) on Ethereum ERC20 tokens.  * This contract provides a way to create and keep HTLCs for $ONCE token.  * Protocol:  *  1) newContract(hashlock, timelock, tokenContract, amount) - a    sender calls this to create a new HTLC on a given token (tokenContract)    for a given amount. A 32 byte contract id is returned 3) refund() - after timelock has expired creator of the HTLC can get their tokens    back with this function.
